channel.title: Ocean Dynamics and Mixing
channel.description: The Ocean Dynamics and Mixing group at the University of Southampton is comprised of faculty, postdoctoral fellows and students. The focus of our group is on ocean observations with the aim of understanding these measurements and comparing with theoretical understandings of the ocean.

item.title: For Wissenschaftsjahr
item.description:
For Germany’s Year of Science 2016-17, Wissenschaftsjahr, the UK was the chosen partner for “Seas and Oceans”. Eleanor was profiled for their website. You can read it in original German, or English.

In German: https://www.wissenschaftsjahr.de/2016-17/das-wissenschaftsjahr/partnerland-vereinigtes-koenigreich/die-pumpe-im-atlantik.html

In English: https://www.wissenschaftsjahr.de/2016-17/weiterfuehrende-informationen/englisch/science-year-201617-seas-and-oceans/the-circulation-pump-in-the-atlantic.html

item.title: MerMEED & OSMOSIS results
item.description: A few of us went to the 49th Liege Colloquium which was the 3rd edition of Marine Turbulence. It was a lovely workshop-sized conference in a beautiful venue. Gwyn and Eleanor presented early results from the MerMEED project, and Xialong and Christian from OSMOSIS.

item.title: FreshWATERS balloon launch
item.description:
We had one of our test balloon launches for the FreshWATERS project in May. It required an early start (before 6am) followed by a car chase of the GPS coordinates given by the balloon.

Photos of the launch (and recovery) in Galleries.

item.title: Autosub Long Range
item.description:
Boaty’s adventures in the Southern Ocean

  • 19 April 2017: Blog post on “Boaty’s second big adventure in the Orkney Passage” by Eleanor: https://dynopocruise2017.blogspot.co.uk

  • 5 April 2017: And on “Boaty’s first big adventure” by Stephen Griffies: https://dynopocruise2017.blogspot.co.uk/2017/04/boatys-first-big-adventure.html

  • 20 March 2017: An article in the Conversation: https://theconversation.com/mcboatface-lead-scientist-how-famed-submarine-will-help-unlock-the-causes-of-deep-sea-warming-74797.

Photos and Videos

Photo highlights of the Autosub Long Range deployments are here: /galleries/autosub/

Here is a compilation video of Boaty McBoatface highlights from Povl Abrahamsen:

Animations

Note: Resolution improves if you pop it out/full screen the video.

As a side project during the DynOPO cruise, I worked on coding an animation of Boaty McBoatface in Matlab along with the MARS/Autosub engineer, Rob Templeton. If you’re curious about creating 3-d visualisations of (radially-symmetric) objects in Matlab, here’s an example (embedded from Vimeo):

Building boaty

Building Boaty using Matlab from Eleanor Frajka-Williams on Vimeo.

Fly-through style animation

Boaty McBoatface M44 in Orkney Passage from Eleanor Frajka-Williams on Vimeo.

item.title: End of DynOPO cruise #2
item.description:
The Dynamics of the Orkney Passage 2017 cruise was from 17 March to 8 May, 2017.

Photos have been uploaded to Galleries.

item.title: EGU Early Career award
item.description: At the 2017 European Geophysical Union general assembly, Eleanor Frajka-Williams was awarded with the Outstanding Early Career Scientist award for Ocean Sciences. Unfortunately, she was in the Southern Ocean and couldn’t be there to receive the award in person.

item.title: Piece in the Conversation about Boaty McBoatface
item.description:
Alberto wrote a piece for the Conversation while we were on the RRS James Clark Ross, crossing Drake Passage towards the Weddell Sea.

It’s got a bit about the project Dynopo (Dynamics of the Orkney Passage Outflow), and also about the Autosub Long Range (ALR). These vehicles have been in development for a while, but after the internet poll to name the new polar research vessel came up with a top naming choice of “Boaty McBoatface”, the ALRs got renamed Boaty McBoatface.

Read more on the Conversation: https://theconversation.com/mcboatface-lead-scientist-how-famed-submarine-will-help-unlock-the-causes-of-deep-sea-warming-74797.

item.title: DynOPO cruise blog
item.description: You can follow our progress at a cruise blog by Stephen Griffies: https://dynopocruise2017.blogspot.co.uk.

item.title: MerMEED first cruise
item.description:
We’ve completed the first small boat cruise for the MerMEED project. 70 VMP profiles collected during 7 days off the Bahamas.

Photos in Galleries.

item.title: Eddy watch in the Bahamas
item.description:
We are now preparing for our first field expedition in the Bahamas for the project MerMEED, watching the near real-time altimetry for the development and progression of eddies in the Atlantic.

Follow the project on https://twitter.com/mermeeduk
